intro: Lindleya glabra, commonly known as the smooth lindleya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in wetland ecosystems.
